meanings.definition: Covering or siding of a building made of wooden boards.
meanings.sent1: The old house had weatherboarded walls that gave it a rustic look.
meanings.sent2: The weatherboarded exterior of the barn protected the animals from the wind.
meanings.sent3: The weatherboarded shed looked like a giant wooden puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The weatherboarded fence stood strong against the test of time.
meanings.sent5: The weatherboarded cabin in the woods was a cozy retreat.

meanings.definition: To cover or side a building with wooden boards.
meanings.sent1: The carpenters weatherboarded the house to protect it from the elements.
meanings.sent2: They weatherboarded the shed to give it a fresh new look.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to weatherboard their clubhouse with imaginary wooden planks.
meanings.sent4: She weatherboarded her emotions, hiding them behind a stoic expression.
meanings.sent5: The artist weatherboarded the canvas with vibrant colors, creating a masterpiece.
